lines.text: No, the sign says "thank you for not smoking." As I am smoking, I don't expect to be thanked.
It is difficult to know where to begin since, unlike you, I already know the ending.
It is so difficult to know where I should begin, especially when, unlike you, I already know the ending. But let us say that this story began with end of another.

But what of you my darling? For no one on earth knows you better than I do. And if you've read thus far, I know you'll never bring yourself to destroy this letter, nor will you ever show it to anyone else. And it will gradually dawn on you that your life might have taken a very different course had you simply been able to open your heart to another. And you'll often return to this letter. You'll read it again and again in the years to come until you no longer have to read what you know by heart. And you'll cherish it as a source of pride in the face of an uncaring world.
I'm getting rather tired of hearing myself say no.
"Hotpants College II" is a puerile romp without a single redeeming feature.
I'm a writer. I write. I don't process words.

[quoting Walt Whitman as a eulogy]
Now Voyager, sail thou forth, to seek and find.

In Europe, it is often the case that a... a young man benefits from the... the wisdom and the experience of an elder. Why, there's almost a tradition of such friendships. Cocteau and Radiguet. Uh, Verlaine, Rimbaud.
